Recipe.title: Pork Chops al Jardinero
Recipe.Description:
"Jardinero" is the Spanish word for gardener. It is pronounced "Har-dee-neh-row".
Ransom prepared this recipe once when he had been out on his mission in Puerto Rico for only a couple of months. His senior companion just about died of pleasure. He said it was the first "real American" meal he had had in over a year!
Later, some members told Ransom what the name of the dish is in Spanish.

section.instruction: Peel Onion, then cut into chunks, then place across the bottom of a large saucepan.
Peel the Potatoes and cut into chunks slightly bigger than the head of a spoon.
Peel the Carrots and cut into chunks about the size of the head of a spoon.
Mix the Potatoes and Carrots together.
Place about ⅓ of the Potatoes and Carrots on top of the Onions, then place 1 Pork Chop on top of them.
Place about ½ of the remaining Potatoes and Carrots on top the Pork Chop, then place the other Pork Chop on top of them.
Place the remaining Potatoes and Carrots on top.
Sprinkle liberally with Salt and Pepper.
Place on stove on high and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes.

Notes.note: Sprinkling the Water on top washes the Salt and Pepper down into everything.
When serving, you can make it look nice if you:
Put the Pork Chops on a platter (or plate).
Put the Potatoes in one bowl.
Put the Carrots in another bowl.
Put the Onions in still another bowl.
Pour the drippings into a gravy bowl or boat.
I like to mash the Potatoes with a fork, then pour a little of the broth on it.
